SENT.plain: We report successful treatment of a refractory myelodysplastic syndrome-associated pyoderma gangrenosum with the combination of thalidomide and interferon-alpha2a in a single patient
A non-healing wound developed on a 40-year-old woman's left thumb after minor trauma
Massive ulcerovegetative lesions developed after reconstruction surgery
Histopathological examination of the bone marrow and cytogenetic studies revealed an atypical myeloproliferative/myelodysplastic syndrome
The skin lesions resolved dramatically after two months of thalidomide and interferon-alpha2a combination therapy and the haematological status improved
